alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:02PM MDT until April 11 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Minor flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sandy Creek at Havre. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Water out of banks in several locations and starting to spread into frequently used pastures, fields, corrals, etc. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Monday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Monday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 06/08/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as necessary or no later than Tuesday morning at 815 AM MDT.
